page.title: 06BURHAM - THE NEW SCHOOL
page.content: The old school was situated on Rochester Road next door to the Windmill Inn. It had stood there since 1858. The village had been promised a new school since 1950. The old school was a Victorian building; the classrooms had very high ceilings with rafters, very high church like windows that no-one could see through. The walls of the old building were cracking and leaky, the classrooms were cold and draughty. The buildings were spread all over the site which meant going outside when visiting the Head Teacher's room, the hall for assembly, the resources centre, some classrooms and also the toilets. When the school closed it catered for 58 children with 2 full time and 3 part time members of staff.
